content:
ICS 1C HW 2 for Linda -- Draft1.html

About QQ Skeleton

Name:Linda Rohrer
E-mail: :easu624@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Social Science/ minor- Spanish

Three neat Web finds:

  1. I can learn about the Solar System.
  2. There are cool pictures of New York.
  3. I can find out about Amateur Radio.

Questions I can now answer
  1. Does the Internet allow me to find information about Amateur Radio Operators and a directory off their call signs?
  2. I am going toNew York over spring break, can I find out what Broadway shows will be playing while I am there?
  3. Can I find out some history on mynext quarters teachers in the area of Social Sciences?
  4. Can I find out more about what classes I need to minor in Spanish which is in the school of Humanities?
  5. I would like to know if there is a way that i can find a list of servers, and if so is there one in Mexico at the UNAM where my best friend is going to study next year?
  1. Does the Internet allow me to find infomation about Amateur Radio Operators and a directory of their calls signs??
    My answer is... Of coarse it does! As I was exploring the El Galaxy, I looked under leisure items and found Amateur Radio. From there I ended up getting the low down on everything I could want to know about Ham operators. First I decided to few the general heading on Amateur Radio Information. This area is a good place to start. From there I went to the Amateur Radio Callbook Server and then to MIT's North American Call book server which led me to the area where I could look up call signs. So naturally I typed in mine first to see how it worked. I pushed in N6YZZ and it pulled up my address, phone number and old call sign. I checked and the rest of my family was in there too. When I have more time I will search into it more indebth.

    Return to list of questions.

  2. I am going to New York over spring break, can I find out what Broadway shows will be playing while I am there?
    I am leaving for Rodchester, New York for spring break in March. My answer starts with a story, I am saving up money to hopefully go to a Broadway show while I am there. I didn't quite know where I should start so I started on my UCI homepage and went down and clicked on to the anchored World Wide Web that was in purple. From there I went to the WWW -The Virtual Tourist which led me to a great map of the world that allows me to pick anything to see. I clicked on City Net and on the next screen I was able to pick the region, being North America, then US, New York and then more specifically between Rodchester and downtown. The Reference Info. puts me right to everything I could possibly want to do. Under Theatres, I found my list of theatres and one said Broadway the Great White Way. This was only possible through many interesting stops along the way.

    Return to list of questions.

  3. Can I find out some history on my next quarters teachers in the area of Social Sciences?
    My answer is...start with the home page because it relays you to all the useful resources that UC Irvine has to offer. To find out about one's particular field of study I went to the Academic programming and research and all of the majors popped up on the screen. I went straight to Social Sciences where I had the choice of choosing between information on my specific department of study, graduate studies, info on particular areas of study, links to many areas of the school as well as faculty and staff information. Faculty tells me briefly about the background or place of study for each individual professor in this field. As I understand it some profesors have chose to enter their picture, infromation about themselves and works, and it includes their Email and school telephone number. A good example of a neat profile is that of William Batchelder. I could get lucky and find lots of info on my next quarter teachers or Email them if I need to ask any questions.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. Can I find out more about what classes I need to minor in Spanish which is in the school of Humanities?
    My answer is...start at home again. The Academic Programs and Research is the key area to be at for informations relating to information on majors or minors. Going to Humanities then sends me to a gopher menu where I choose to look at the Spanish and Portuguese department. Once the text comes up it doesn't look that exciting but the key point is that in the humanities one does not know who the staff is or their backgrounds in the lower devision areas. In the higher levels there are descriptions about the classes to take, requirements needed, visting profesors and many of the politics. It basically is an updated version of the UCI catalog of background with extra add ons.

    Return to list of questions.

  5. I would like to know if there is a way that I can find a list of servers, and if so is there one in Mexico at the UNAM where my best friend is going to study next year?
    My answer is...Yes there is! First place I started was under Navigate and starting points and then to Web Overview with led me to Places to start exploring. Next thing I knew there was a lists of Servers from around the world. I naturally clicked to Latin America, Mexico and then UNAM the University in which she will be studying. UNAM is a very popular University in Mexico and what the server does is hooks me up to a gopher that tells me about the school. Although this is were I do have to bring my Spanish skills into action. I am excited to have found this. Mosaic, known as a browser or server pulls up many wonderful things that I can explore.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted February 13, 1995 for ICS 1C
